title: How many Amazon Kindle publishing accounts can one person have? - Quora

response.answer_text: One. It is a TOS violation to have more than 1. You cant seem to have a personal account, and a company one acting a publisher account, but that’s it. You can have as many pen names as you want, on your one account. No-one sees into your KDP account, so the author name you use on any book, is never going to be tracked back to you that way. Author Central allows 3 pen names per AC account. You sign up to AC separately than KDP. And I believe you can have an AC account for each pen name. Author Central provides author profile pages, and having a separate one for each pen name, is advisable, also so people wont track a pen name back to the actual author. But KDP? 1. One.

You can only have one. If you can sign up for another account it will eventually be blocked. They only accept one account and they can monitor your IP address that's why you can't have multiple accounts. They don't harbor posers.
